title: Senegal’s president says he won’t run again. Democracy advocates applaud.
description: Macky Sall's bid for a third term could have violated Senegal's constitution. His decision follows nationwide protests against another term.

title: How months of raids on Jenin led to a major West Bank military operation
description: Since a January raid in Jenin, operations in the city have continued to escalate, culminating in Monday’s massive military operation.

title: Global shipping industry faces head winds over going green
description: Ocean transport contributes about 3 percent of humankind’s greenhouse gas emissions, equivalent to the output of Germany, which is among the top 10 polluters.

title: Hong Kong police offer hefty reward for intel on political exiles
description: It is the first time Hong Kong police have offered cash rewards for information on the political dissidents involved in the protests over China's control of the semiautonomous city.

title: In Photos: Israel invades West Bank city, killing at least 8 Palestinians
description: Israel launched extensive air and ground attacks on Jenin starting early Monday, striking what it called a militant “operational command center” in a further escalation in the occupied West Bank city that is a hub of armed Palestinian resistance.

title: The latest game show topic in China: X_ J_np_ng
description: In today's China, everyone is being tested on Xi Jinping Thought — schoolkids, game show contestants, tech workers, Communist Party bigwigs. Everyone.

title: Celebrated Ukrainian war writer killed in Russian strike on restaurant
description: Victoria Amelina, who won awards for books such as "Fall Syndrome," was fatally injured in last week's attack on a pizza restaurant in Kramatorsk, Ukraine.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Moscow has taken 700,000 children out of Ukraine, Russian lawmaker says
description: Ukrainian Deputy Defense Minister Hanna Maliar said forces are engaged in fierce fighting in the east and progressing in the south, particularly near Bakhmut.

title: As war nears Crimea, Russian occupiers are trying to lure tourists
description: The peninsula, annexed illegally by Moscow in 2014, is a favorite summer destination for Russians. Now the conflict threatens to destroy the tourism on which it depends.

title: Israel strikes Jenin in the occupied West Bank; 3 killed, Palestinians say
description: The Israel Defense Forces said it targeted a command center that Jenin Brigade militants were thought to be operating in a refugee camp.

title: Treasury secretary to make first trip to China seeking better relations
description: Janet L. Yellen jets to Beijing this week in a test of the administration’s ability to improve relations with China while seeking to cut U.S. companies’ reliance on Chinese factories.
